intro: Tristagma recurvifolium, commonly known as the curlyleaf false indigo, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has narrow, curling leaves that give it its common name, and it typically grows in rocky or sandy soils. Tristagma recurvifolium is a perennial shrub that thrives in full sun and is often found in desert or arid environments. Its botanical features make it an attractive and drought-tolerant plant for xeriscaping.
